I ran this command: echo | openssl s_client -connect bitbucket.org:443 | grep Protocol

and the result is Protocol  : TLSv1.2

fields.description:
It appears that files with the extension '.sql' may be using Pygment's Transact-SQL lexer for syntax highlighting, rather than the normal SQL lexer.

I did run a piece of code through Pygment's [demo|http://pygments.org/demo/] and found the outcome to support this theory... the demo correctly highlights the code using the SQL language selection, while using the Transact-SQL selection produces highlighting similar to Bitbucket Cloud.
fields.summary: File viewer's SQL highlighting incorrect

Hoy can relly delete this team name?
fields.summary: Removed team still in same place.

fields.description:
Similar to BCLOUD-5196

To reproduce:

# Create a PR
# Show some lines that were originally not shown (not edited)
# Comment on one of those lines
# Reload the page
# Comment isn't visible

You can go find the comment through the Activity tab, but on a busy PR, this is likely to become lost
fields.summary: PR comments on initially-hidden lines are hidden

fields.description:
A change was recently made to the way webhook logging works, which has broken a common use case.  If a webhook fails for whatever reason, it used to be possible to go to the logs and resend the request - but now that webhook logging turns itself off after 12 hours, you're unlikely to catch a failed request in the logs (unless you manually turn the logging on again for every repo every day when you get to work, so that you have logging enabled throughout the day... but ain't nobody got time for that).  See [#17498|BCLOUD-17498] and the comments therein for examples of other people frustrated by this change for the same reason.

If storage space was becoming an issue with the previous approach, perhaps a more useful compromise would be to impose a rolling retention limit - either storing logs for only X hours, or storing only the latest X requests per repository.  Perhaps there could still be an option (for those who need it) to temporarily enable full log retention for a longer period (i.e. if the standard rolling retention period is 1 hour, the option could still be to retain logs for up to 12 hours, per the current option).

Note: I have filed this as a bug rather than an enhancement, as this is effectively a regression (a use case which was previously supported is no longer supported after the change to webhook logging).
fields.summary: Please rethink webhook logging changes

fields.description:
I'm writing a custom script to bump up a RELEASE_VERSION and BUILD_NUMBER variables in a repository and currently I'm using an App Password tied to my account. I wanted to find out if there is a way to have a higher level authentication token that I can use which would not be tied to my account. I see that there is a x-auth-token:$REPOSITORY_OAUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN being used by the pipeline to pull the repository down during the initial step. I tried using that but it did not work.

This is how I was using it:\\
curl -s -X GET --user "x-token-auth:$REPOSITORY_OAUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN" "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/$BITBUCKET_REPO_OWNER/$BITBUCKET_REPO_SLUG/pipelines_config/variables/" but it returned no response.
fields.summary: Best way to authenticate with BitBucket API

fields.description: It would be great to opt out of push console messages (as it is today) but that also opts out pull request URLs - Would it be possible to separate these two into two separate opt-out options?
fields.summary: Ability to opt out of push console messages without losing the ability to see Pull Request URLs

fields.description:
The pipeline suddenly fails to run npm. Even when I tried to rerun successful build commits it returns the same error.

Kindly find an attached screenshot of the error.
fields.summary: npm install fails.

fields.description:
As a follow-up ticket from "[HTML reports in bitbucket pipelines?|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/HTML-reports-in-bitbucket-pipelines/qaq-p/945417%3Futm_source%3Datlcomm%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_campaign%3Dimmediate_general_answer%26utm_content%3Dtopic]":

My company (www.touchsurgery.com / www.digitalsurgery.com) heavily relies on bitbucket pipelines for every single thing, including running headless selenium tests and we'd like a way to see a more pretty HTML reports with screenshots like bamboo had or any other CI out there.\\
All we need is a simple way to view static HTML pages based on the already existing report system under the 'test results' tab instead of the parsed xunit reports.
fields.summary: HTML reports in bitbucket pipelines

fields.description:
Bitbucket is under continuous development - which is great. This inevitably brings need for some breaking changes that might disrupt some customers workflows.

The best way how users would be able to test whether they are correctly prepared for upcomming breaking change (target IP change; removing TLS v1.0 support; API deprecation etc.) is by providing staging cloud for user acceptance testing.

Users will be able to easier prepare for the changes, and you'll be able to receive earlier feedback
fields.summary: Public staging cloud with upcoming breaking changes

fields.description:
In a step of a pipeline with declared artifacts, in the "Artifacts" tab, click on the download icon.

A download to disk will work just fine. But if you tell your browser to open the file with a file manager instead, the file named artifact_91725165fhhnhnn1c84odjks1956.tar.gz would be suddenly named artifact_91725165fhhnhnn1c84odjks1956.tar-N.gz, where N seems to be the number of times the download has been attempted after the first time.

This will make most file managers refuse to open the file.
fields.summary: Pipeline artifacts can only be opened once by each user

fields.description:
Pull request pipelines have been added as per issue BCLOUD-13438. However, the [pipeline documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/configure-bitbucket-pipelines-yml-792298910.html#Configurebitbucket-pipelines.yml-ci_pull-requests] currently states:

bq. This only applies to pull requests initiated from within your repository; pull requests from a forked repository will not trigger the pipeline.


In our workflow, each developer has their own fork from which they initiate pull requests to our main repository. I'd like to be able to turn on a pull request pipeline on the main repository and have it triggered when a pull request is initiated from a fork.
fields.summary: Add ability to run pull request pipeline when PR is initiated from a fork

fields.description:

When I check my Pull Request on mobile Android, I have always this annoying left sidebar menu with the action available on the current repository where I'm which occupied almost all my screen. (See the picture with this sidebar circle in red) So it's really no practical for using bucket repository view from mobile.

It would be nice to have a button which allows us to hide/show the left sidebar. (See the button I'm talking about on the picture underlined in green).

Thanks you.
fields.summary: Add feature to hide/show the left sidebar on repository view

fields.description:
If you use the boolean 'yes' statement in certain Pipelines environment variables, they will pass in the Pipelines yml validator, but then fail within the build itself.

As a workaround, you can simply set these values to "true" for the time being.
fields.summary: Environment variable unable to parse "yes" in Pipelines build

fields.description: Since it is a pretty common scenario having some projects that are old/legacy on an existing account, it would be nice to have a feature to mark a repository as "old" or "unused" and have it hide from view on the user repositories overview page, making these show up on a specific, new tab, if filtered correctly.
fields.summary: Ability to hide repositories on team accounts

fields.description:
Bitbucket Cloud [only supports|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/which-browsers-does-bitbucket-support-296092232.html] Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Internet Explorer, and Microsoft Edge.

It would be nice to add support for the Brave browser as there are some features that don't seem to work on it, such as Pipelines.
fields.summary: Add Brave to supported browsers

fields.description: It would be really useful to see in the bitbucket 'users on plan' overview which accounts are managed and which accounts are not.
fields.summary: Show users with Atlassian Access in "Users on plan" screen

fields.description: We had a security incident where one of our repositories was accidentally made public by someone. It would be great if the owner gets notified via email or something when a private repository is changed to public.
fields.summary: Notify the owner when the repository is changed from private to public

fields.description:
In my company the workflow is: PRs are reviewed, and after approval is given the original author merges to master. However I cannot know that one of my PRs has been approved without checking on all of my open PRs across all repos, as no email notification is sent when the approval is given.

(I would hope that a notification is at least sent when a PR is declined; if not change subject accordingly to cover both cases)
fields.summary: Create notification when an PR is approved

fields.description: Our workflow uses 2 main branches, "dev" and "release".  We'd like merge requests to default to the dev branch and clones and such to default to the release branch.  Currently, we have to choose one or the other to designate "main" branch.
fields.summary: Allow separate default clone and default merge request branches
Web editor shows N+1 lines in a file with N lines for N>0.

fields.description:
h3. Feature Request
In app comment notifications

h3. Problem
Correspondence between users on PRs is hard to track. My colleagues and I resort to "bumping" each other over slack to let the other know that we made new comments. Then we go into the respective PR and look for the responses. Email notifications don't help because they send and receive periodically. Also, pretty much no one on our team uses email, anyway. However, our team _always_ has bitbucket open and we all check it about every 15 minutes.

h3. Request
It would be nice if there was a comment notification tray. It could appear next to the PR notification tray. There you could view new comments and navigate directly to the comment in order to reply.

h3. Acceptance Criteria
* I receive in app notifications for comments
* I can view notifications for comments
* I can navigate directly to comments from notifications
fields.summary: In-app comment notifications

fields.description:
Hey!

I have a small one for you all. When looking at PRs I have created (https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/pullrequests?section=created), I would like to be able to click almost anywhere on the row -- at least on the description -- and be linked to the PR in question. Instead, I have to click on the tiny PR number associated with the PR, which is only distinguishable as a link if I hover over it.

Thanks,\\
Aaron
fields.summary: Please make the rows when viewing PRs I have created link to the PR

fields.description: We have a _lot_ of repos, and it's time consuming to go into each looking for new PR's - it would be nice to be able to see them all together somewhere.
fields.summary: Ability to see all open PR's across all repos

fields.description:
It's hard to know when a new build has been triggered by a new commit + push.\\
I currently have to:

* Start on a build for a branch
* Click on "Pipelines" in the breadcrumb
* Look for the latest new build for my branch, if there is one
* Click on that build and hope it's the latest for my branch

I would prefer if i could:

* Start on a build for a branch
* See that there are newer builds for the branch
* Click on the latest build for the branch
fields.summary: When viewing a build for a branch, provide a way to easily navigate to the latest build for that branch

fields.description:
Something went wrong\\
While we check things on our end, refresh the page and contact support if the problem persists.

When contacting support, provide them with this code:

ed05c0beab324f8985ae7281ba9761c5
fields.summary: An error occurs when the person in charge opens the assignment being allocated

fields.description:
hi

i cant view my tickets in our repository

screnshot : https://www.screencast.com/t/u3uDfkB927gE

code : a9de6acb02a548daaeb85c805e70ced4
fields.summary: cant view bitbucket tickets

fields.description:
h3. Issue
We are having issues with Pipelines and due to this, we are unable to deliver our code & affecting our deliverables.

h3. What happens
In our bitbucket-pipelines.yml, our projects' pipelines are failing on npm install with 'npm ERR! 404 401 Unauthorized'.

Looks something as following:

_npm ERR! code E401_

_npm ERR! 404 401 Unauthorized: @webassemblyjs/wasm-edit@1.7.11_

Please see below image for a detailed view of error:

!1017910-Capture.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Bitbucket pipelines fail on npm install

fields.description:
After renaming a project all the issues that had a link got broken, it included not only things on description of tickets, but also links from the pull request sections, branches and commits.

For example:\\
We had a project called {{course-java}} and we renamed it to {{course-softdev}}, and then, if we try to open anything that was done before the renaming we get a 404 error.

For example, if we try to open a pull request for an old ticket directly from JIRA like this:\\
!2600660943-Captura%20de%20Tela%202018-11-27%20%C3%A0s%2018.58.35.png|thumbnail!

We get the following error:\\
!629539078-Captura%20de%20Tela%202018-11-27%20%C3%A0s%2018.57.40.png|thumbnail!

What happens is that when we rename the project, the links continue being the same, like {{https://bitbucket.org/globalmentor/course-java/pull-requests/63}}, when it should be updated as well, like {{https://bitbucket.org/globalmentor/course-softdev/pull-requests/63}}.

Is this something that will be fixed in the future? It's really bad to see broken links if we want to rename any project.
fields.summary: Links in Jira broken after renaming repository in Bitbucket

fields.description:
I'm used to using CMD+Enter to confirm dialog buttons, such as Resolving a ticket writing a comment and submitting.

Currently i have to manually click the "Change" button with the mouse to submit a resolved comment (see screenshot).

Ideally after i've finished commenting (CMD+Enter) would submit the comment.
fields.summary: CMD+Enter to confirm dialog buttons

fields.description:
Currently in Bitbucket, API calls return a generic 500 error with the message "Something went wrong" for any failures.

Such errors include authentication failed due to branch permissions, repository I/O issues, Pull request merge etc.

It would be nice to return more descriptive status codes and error messages to troubleshoot the issue.
fields.summary: Add error handling to common errors on API calls

fields.description:
Hello,

I've try to find it, but i failed.\\
I'm here to make a suggestion: show the date when we join (sign up) to this website (or on atlassian).\\
Could you add it ?

Thanks :)
fields.summary: Date join website
Cache node is missing

fields.description:
It would be nice if when viewing teams at https://bigbucket.org/username/profile/teams they were listed similar to how repositories are listed at https://bigbucket.org/username/profile/repositories.

Currently a team name cannot get very long before it is shortened and you have to hover your cursor over the name to know what the full name is, especially if there's multiple teams with the same shortened name. This is however at least slightly better than GitHub, where presently there is no way to list a user's organizations and when hovering over the icon for an organisation the names are again shortened, so you have to then hover the cursor over the shortened name and check the bottom left corner of the browser window for the link. GitLab on the other hand lists groups in a way that longer names are still readable without having to hover the cursor anywhere or follow any links!

I have attached screenshots from BitBucket, GitHub and GitLab.
fields.summary: Listing teams similar to how repositories are listed

fields.description:
I am getting a 500 when fetching tags via: https://bitbucket.org/!api/2.0/repositories/bsentient/linux-imx/refs/tags?q=name+%7E+%22%22&pagelen=50&page=3&sort=name

This prevents our Cloudbees Jenkins plugin from triggering builds.

I can provide the HAR for the request, but would prefer not to do so via a public bug tracker.
fields.summary: Getting 500 fetching tags

fields.description:
I'm trying to use the search in the Commit view, and it does not seem to be possible to search for a word with an accent in it.

I have a commit message with the word "mémoire" in it. Let's try to find it:

!1649130039-accent_search_1.PNG|thumbnail!

No luck. Let's try writing the word without the accent:

!3599459055-accent_search_2.PNG|thumbnail!

No luck either. Now if we search with the part of the word which doesn't have an accent:

!1068985793-accent_search_3.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Search cannot find word with accent

fields.description: On Bitbucket Cloud, there is no way to sync several repositories together (like a Upstream and a Fork for example) making it impossible to work with a [Forking Workflow|https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials/comparing-workflows/forking-workflow] if not using Bitbucket Server (self hosted repositories).
fields.summary: Missing `Enable Fork Sync` option on Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description:
We were looking for an app like https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213087/simple-bitbucket-commit-checker?hosting=server&tab=overview which would be able to implement all of our requirements.

It is available only for bitbucket server, though!

We have already made use of links in our repository to reject the commit if it does not include a JIRA ID. However, we are also looking to implement the following requirements

# Do not let a commit to master that does not have a fix version in the JIRA that was adding as the commit message.
# Do not let a commit to a feature-branch that does not match the fix-version in JIRA that was added as the commit message
# Do not let a commit on a JIRA which is not in In-Progress (where the JIRA is the one mentioned in the commit message).
fields.summary: We need something similar of Commit Checker

fields.description:
It would be nice if "Tags" were ordered by most recent tag first by default (reverse semantic version) -- which is how GitHub orders them.

It's increasingly difficult to locate the most recent Tag in the UI. Currently, you have to scroll a mile down to find the value.
fields.summary: UI - Tags order

fields.description:
Hello

We are using bitbucket cloud for our git repo and also use slack. We are using integration of bitbucket into slack.

We have noticed that the merge through slack does not follow the default strategy which is defined in our project in bitbucket. So every time, we have to manually change the strategy while doing merge from slack. Sometimes people forget and we end up with a situation of our git history looking not like what we want to.

It would be great to have slack merge follow the same strategy as bitbucket or provide a setting to set the strategy in the bitbucket app within slack.

Thanks
fields.summary: Slack merge strategy does not adhere to bitbucket cloud's merge strategy
"This merge is too large to display.

fields.description:
Hi!

After trying to import the repository from a self-hosted Gitlab repository, I am getting the error below. Before I submit the importing, I also get the error "No repository exists at that URL.", but as far as I read, that's not an issue if you use authorization.

{code}
#!python

Your import has failed. For more information, check the log below. You can also try your import again.


07:16:17 git import for: **https://some.domain/path/torepo.git**
07:16:17 Cloning **https://some.domain/path/torepo.git**...
07:16:17 Cloning into bare repository '**placeholder for group/repo**'...
07:16:17 fatal: unable to access '**https://some.domain/path/torepo.git**/': Peer's Certificate issuer is not recognized.
07:16:18 Remote Git clone failed: <class 'bitbucket.apps.async.tasks.ImportException'>: Command failed. Return value: 128

{code}

So I tried to clone it locally and I also got this error, but when I enabled sslVerify to the git config, it was working locally. So what's the correct setting in order to import the repository?\\
It is working fine against Github.\\
Do I need to use some other specific credentials for authorization?

PS: We use Letsencrypt certificate at the self-hosted Gitlab domain, but this shouldn't be an issue right?

Thank you!
fields.summary: Importing the repository from self-hosted Gitlab

fields.description:
Link: https://bitbucket.org/---dele/ted---

I thought that was a temporary glitch but it has lasted for months. :(

(I couldn't figure out how to raise a new "support request" on [this page|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/], sorry.)
fields.summary: My project is unaccessible (404)

fields.description:
Similar to how it works on Confluence and Jira, it would be nice to show the issue type and status on Bitbucket instead of having to click on the issue itself.

!216436017-Screen%20Shot%202018-11-23%20at%2016.07.19.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: See Jira status on issue links without having to click on the issue number

fields.description: Successfully scheduled pipilene. In schedulled time Bitbucket fails to find "bitbucket-pipelines.yml" in schedulled branch. "bitbucket-pipelines.yml" exists in this branch.
fields.summary: Bitbucket fails to find bitbucket-pipelines.yml

fields.description:
We have a master branch and uat branch.

We created a branch (test_location_pinning) from master and made some changes. On creating pull request to master, it shows diff. But creating  a PR to uat is not showing any diff. It shows the below message

We couldn't load the diff\\
If you'd like to continue, you can still create the pull request without seeing the diff.
fields.summary: Branch merge shows We couldn't load the diff

fields.description:
Hi Guys,

I'm trying to fetch public ssh-keys from the user account (from bitbucket site). I'm using oauth2 for authentication and provide request with access token in the headers.

But I'm getting a 403 error with a message

'{"type": "error", "error": {"message": "This API is only accessible with the following authentication types: session, password, apppassword"}}'

I'm using url from this documentation page

https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/users/%7Busername%7D/ssh-keys#get

I don't see there any mentions about some specific authentication limitations

I have tried requests to hooks and repositories endpoints for same user with the same access token all successful.

And I have account read scope for my oauth consumer

It looks like I cannot use oauth to fetch user's ssh-keys. What should I use then? How to fetch ssh-keys for the user via REST API 2?

Also, it seems to work for REST API v1
fields.summary: Get ssh-keys for the user REST API version 2 with oauth

fields.description:
Currently, upon deleting a repository, the page will redirect you to the Dashboard page. - https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview

*Suggestion:*

It would be nice if users will be redirected to the list of repositories owned by the team or individual account where the repository was deleted.
fields.summary: UI: Deleting a repository redirects you to Dashboard page

fields.description:
It would be great if we can implement a second layer of security or verification when deleting a repository.

*Suggestion*:

It would be nice if we can add a verification to ask the user to type their repository name before the actual deletion.

@fstefanelli - It would be great to add a second approval from another administrator before actually deleting the repository.
fields.summary: UI: Deleting repository confirmation

fields.description: Since our workflow is entirely forked based - which I think is increasingly common - pull request pipelines are not available to us.  Hoping you'll support this soon.
fields.summary: Run pull request pipelines from forked repository

fields.description: The content area on certain screens (like Pull Requests, and even this bug report screen) the side bar obscures the content area so you can't see or use the UI underneath. The content area is supposed to be responsive to the side bar width but it seems like something has gone wrong.
fields.summary: UI Issue: side panel covers the working area

fields.description:
Hi supporter,\\
Can you pls check for us why we always meet bitbucket is very slow to merge and accept after 9 or 10 AM  GMT+0. We have the issue day by day.\\
https://www.useloom.com/share/3ec67d98ec4c47c28cb1484423524e68\\
https://www.useloom.com/share/41c2ebde56a94e15a7b0f930b83689d8\\
Regards,\\
Cuong Ta
fields.summary: Bitbucket is very slow after 9AM or 10AM GMT+0

fields.description:
When entering a command

{code}
#!
ssh -v git@bitbucket.org

{code}

Console displays

{code}
#!

OpenSSH_7.7p1, OpenSSL 1.0.2p  14 Aug 2018
debug1: Reading configuration data /etc/ssh/ssh_config
debug1: Connecting to bitbucket.org [18.205.93.0] port 22.
debug1: Connection established.
debug1: identity file /c/Users/KFF_8.1_7m/.ssh/id_rsa type 0
debug1: key_load_public: No such file or directory
debug1: identity file /c/Users/KFF_8.1_7m/.ssh/id_rsa-cert type -1
debug1: key_load_public: No such file or directory
debug1: identity file /c/Users/KFF_8.1_7m/.ssh/id_dsa type -1
debug1: key_load_public: No such file or directory
debug1: identity file /c/Users/KFF_8.1_7m/.ssh/id_dsa-cert type -1
debug1: key_load_public: No such file or directory
debug1: identity file /c/Users/KFF_8.1_7m/.ssh/id_ecdsa type -1
debug1: key_load_public: No such file or directory
debug1: identity file /c/Users/KFF_8.1_7m/.ssh/id_ecdsa-cert type -1
debug1: key_load_public: No such file or directory
debug1: identity file /c/Users/KFF_8.1_7m/.ssh/id_ed25519 type -1
debug1: key_load_public: No such file or directory

debug1: key_load_public: No such file or directory

{code}

Why can this occur and why is id_rsa defined as type 0?
fields.summary: Validation error access rights

fields.description:
I am not native english speaker.

I use Jira in Polish language and all issues have Polish names.

Using UTF diacritical letters with "create branch" on Bitbucket feature removes letter so branch names are unreadable and don't make sense.

Please convert diacritical characters to its non-diacritical versions like this:

ą -> a

ć -> c

ę -> e

ł -> l

ń -> n

ó -> o

ś -> s

ź -> z

ż -> z
fields.summary: Problematic branch names when diacritical / accented characters are used during creation

fields.description: It would be cool for audit trail to see an exact date and timestamp when a pipeline is build in the  pipelines/home page. Now it is only viewable if you open a pipeline and hover on on the date icon.
fields.summary: Show exact date and time stamp on Pipelines list page

fields.description:
It would be a good feature to have an API to clear existing Cache in Pipelines.

h3. Actual Result
If there was an existing Cache in Pipelines (not cleared yet), the only way to update that Cache is to manually remove it in Bitbucket UI then run a new build.

*Reference*: https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/caching-dependencies-895552876.html

h3. Suggestion
To have an API endpoint to clear the existing Cache.

*Benefits*: To help some CI process where there should be no need to do manual steps.
fields.summary: Pipelines: Clear existing Caches via API

fields.description:
It would be a good feature to automatically update an existing Cache when it gets updated to a certain build.

*Example Scenario*:\\
Feature update could be that the package.json also gets cached and compared to the package.json getting built and if there are any differences in dependency versions, the cache is purged and rebuilt automatically.
fields.summary: Pipelines: Automatically update existing Cache if updated

fields.description: Would need some sort of country ID set in account / Atlassian account beforehand
fields.summary: Security: Send an e-mail when a user logins in to your account from a different country

fields.description:
I would like to be able to create artifacts that are considered secret. They should be passed between build stages, but not cached and not made available for download by repository users.

The use case is we need to generate various password and secret files which are used throughout a build but which are more easily brought in during a single initial step. Currently, doing this results in the generated secrets files being made available to all users of the repository.
fields.summary: Secret artifacts
api.bitbucket.org/swagger.json is invalid

fields.description:
Like it is done in Jira/Confluence, I would like to be able to ensure that only the users that belong to my organization/domain are allowed to have access to the workspaces that I own on Bitbucket.

This functionality would enforce that:

# Only the users with the email address that matches my organization/domain are allowed to have access to my workspace/shared workspace.
# Forks and branches are allowed to be done, however, its content cannot be shared with third-parties and, only the users in my organization/domain are able to view and edit.
fields.summary: Limit the access to those who are part of SSO/SAML only

fields.description:
According to https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/configure-bitbucket-pipelines-yml-792298910.html, Pipelines has a limit of 10 steps per Pipeline build

It would be great to allow an increase in this number, as 10 steps on a single build, on some use cases, are not enough
fields.summary: Allow more than 10 steps per build

fields.description:
When you try to use standard emoji's in your README.md, they are about 3 times taller than normal text.

Problem is less noticable for bigger headers.

Example code to put into README:

{{Normal text :whale2:}}
fields.summary: Emojis are oversized in Markdown READMEs

fields.description:
Hello,

My Repository  exide limit of storage and need to delete some bin/obj files.

See details for attachment.\\
Please advice.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Not able to delete contain from repo directly

fields.description:
Updating Credit Card credentials results in the bug mentioned.\\
Btw: How can I add an additional billing contact to our contract on team "gejos" ? Currently I have to forward every email to my collegues.
fields.summary: Bug report: 045d3ab83fd6415095b238d386864cf9

fields.description:
I am unable to GET, PUT and DELETE variables through the /2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/pipelines_config/variables/{variable_uuid} endpoint. Whatever I do, I get a 401 Unauthorized response.

However, GET /2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/pipelines_config/variables/ DOES work, and i can see two variables being set.

I have the following permissions:

Repositories: Read, Write, Admin\\
Pipelines: Read, Write, Edit Variables

I am using Oauth 1.0 authentication using the Authorization header. Using Postman and a PHP library (Bitbucket\Api) are getting the same result.

Am I doing something wrong or is this endpoint buggy?
fields.summary: pipeline_config variable endpoint broken? 401 unauthorized but permission is set

fields.description:
I created a pipeline build to learn. It created the pipeline build in the master branch. Since I don't know much about Pipeline, I want to remove it but, could not find a way to delete it.

If there is no way to delete a build then I would want to propose a feature that enables a user to delete the Pipeline build built by the user himself/herself.
fields.summary: Delete Pipelilne build
